|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;; |cpu1_cores = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |cpu1_type = <!-- ARM,MIPS,x86-64,PowerPC, --> |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = <!-- CPU1 speed, MHz, GHz, Leave blank if unknown --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->

|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;; |rad2chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |rad2chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac/ax |rad2ax = 4804 |acqam2 = <!-- AC-qam --> |rad2ac = 1733 |rad2n = 600 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== VDSL 35b, G.fast 212MHz, GPON, 802.11ax (Wi-Fi 6)
*[https://www.sagemcom.com/en/cp-sagemcom-unveils-next-generation-multi-gigabit-solutions ''Sagemcom unveils the Next-Generation Multi-Gigabit solutions''] <small> :The VDSL 35b / G.fast / FTTH / PON universal gateway, F@ST 5380, integrates G.fast 212MHz, :GPON and 802.11ax Wi-Fi, enabling the operators to deliver Multi-Gigabit end-toend services, :and to meet the growing bandwidth required by the end-users. </small> <!-- The VDSL 35B / G.fast / FTTH / PON universal gateway, F@st 5380, integrates G.fast 212MHz, GPON and 802.11ax Wi-Fi, enabling the operators to deliver Multi-Gigabit end-toend services, and to meet the growing bandwidth required by the end-users. F@st 5380 benefits from the last innovations of the in-house field proven Sagemcom SWAN™ software suite including big data, Wi-Fi distribution, smart diagnostics…
The next generation Fiber gateways range includes two products: • F@st 5688ax for 10G PON (XGS-PON, 10G EPON, up to NG-PON2), enables end-toend 10Gbps symmetric routing throughput ; • F@st 5670 for 2.5 Gbps GPON.
Both implement the latest 802.11ax Wi-Fi technology.
The third generation of our DOCSIS 3.1 & 32*8 gateway, F@st3890, is designed in a very compact form factor. This product can implement either in-house field proven Sagemcom SWAN™ software suite or the well-known RDK-B.
In addition to the above comprehensive range, and in order to enhance the user experience, Sagemcom proposes Wi-Fi smart extenders, in dual-band and tri-band. These products, associated with steering and monitoring solutions, offer a dynamic response to the varying Wi-Fi environment and the best use of the Wi-Fi capacity. New voice control and home automation solutions are also available enabling operators to offer innovative services.
A live demonstration of these solutions is available at the Sagemcom booth #C102 at the Broadband World Forum 2017 in Berlin. -->
==See also== :;[[Sagemcom]] • [[AVM]] • FCC ID - [https://fccid.io/VW3FAST VW3FAST] • [https://fcc.report/FCC-ID/VW3 VW3] *[[Sagemcom F@ST 3890]] • DOCSIS 3.1/3.0 32x8 Modem Gateway *[[Sagemcom F@ST 3890AX]] • DOCSIS 3.1/3.0 32x8 Modem Gateway *[[Sagemcom F@ST 5380]] • VDSL 35b/G.fast/FTTH/PON Gateway *[[Sagemcom F@ST 5670]] • 2.5Gbps GPON Gateway *[[Sagemcom F@ST 5688AX]] • 10Gbps PON (XGS-PON, 10G EPON, NG-PON2)
[[Category:English Documentation]]
